title: Level 5 Measurement Practice Test
description: Test your skills with metric conversions, area, volume, and time at the Level 5 standard.

questions.question: How many metres are in $3.2 \text{ km}$?
What is the area of a triangle with base $8 \text{ cm}$ and height $5 \text{ cm}$?
What is $3\text{:}45$ pm in 24-hour time?
questions.explanation: To convert pm to 24-hour time, add $12$ to the hours: $3 + 12 = 15$. So $3\text{:}45$ pm $= 15\text{:}45$.

questions.question: A box is $10 \text{ cm}$ long, $8 \text{ cm}$ wide, and $5 \text{ cm}$ high. What is its volume?
Which is longer: $2{,}500 \text{ mm}$ or $3 \text{ m}$?
questions.explanation: Convert $3 \text{ m}$ to mm: $3 \times 1{,}000 = 3{,}000 \text{ mm}$. Since $3{,}000 > 2{,}500$, $3 \text{ m}$ is longer.

questions.question: A train departs at $14\text{:}25$ and arrives at $16\text{:}10$. How long is the journey?
questions.explanation: From $14\text{:}25$ to $15\text{:}00$ = $35$ min. From $15\text{:}00$ to $16\text{:}00$ = $60$ min. From $16\text{:}00$ to $16\text{:}10$ = $10$ min. Total: $35 + 60 + 10 = 105$ min = $1$ hour $45$ minutes.

questions.question: Convert $6{,}500 \text{ g}$ to kilograms. Write your answer as a decimal.
A rectangular prism has a volume of $240 \text{ cm}^3$. Its length is $10 \text{ cm}$ and its width is $6 \text{ cm}$. What is its height?
questions.explanation: Volume $=$ length $\times$ width $\times$ height. So $240 = 10 \times 6 \times$ height $= 60 \times$ height. Height $= 240 \div 60 = 4 \text{ cm}$.

questions.question: Find the area of a triangle with a base of $14 \text{ cm}$ and a height of $8 \text{ cm}$. Write your answer in $\text{cm}^2$.
A bus departs at $07\text{:}50$ and arrives at $09\text{:}15$. How many minutes is the journey?
questions.explanation: From $07\text{:}50$ to $08\text{:}00$ = $10$ min. From $08\text{:}00$ to $09\text{:}00$ = $60$ min. From $09\text{:}00$ to $09\text{:}15$ = $15$ min. Total: $10 + 60 + 15 = 85$ minutes.
